result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Form dated 10/12/2022 from defendant requesting a bail reduction.
Attorney Pablo Galaviz
Competency Report filed by Dr. Goebel
Review hearing on November 8, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Letter from Dr. Goebel requesting an extension on the return of the competency evaluation.
**Reviewed by Judge Dorow on 9/22/2022 - The extension is approved, all of the defendant's cases are to be set on 11/8/2022 at 9:30 AM.*
Hearing on September 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
proposed competency evaluation

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms/knives. Defendant to have no contact with Witness A/Witness B/Witness C listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

1:00 PM Defendant Angel M Michael in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Wang appears as friend of the court as they were unable to meet with the defendant. Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Court advises of right to an attorney. COURT ORDERS FOR COMPETENCY PURSUANT TO SEC.. 971.14(2).  Court orders the defendant be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  To be done as an outpatient basis within 30 days. The Court will set this matter before the Trial Court as soon as possible to allow for the Trial Court to determine whether a review on competency is appropriate. Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on September 16, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

2:56 PM Defendant Angel M Michael not in court, in custody. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marruto.  Court notifies attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez that the defendant is represented by Attorney Amanda Nimmer on their other matters.  The Court was notified the defendant has refused to come to Court today.  Court sets matter over for an initial appearance tomorrow.  The Court authorizes use of force to bring the defendant to Court tomorrow.
Initial appearance scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
